Topic.Title: Tech, do you still have some scam LEAPS on hand?

Message.Msg: I find it interesting how you claim to know everyone's positions, especially those that haven't been posted. I don't really understand the point. Even if you were right (obviously intentionally wrong in this case), it would beg the question how you gain access to said information.... They "held" the uptrend line today... But the reality is time is strongly against anyone with a large position in this stock. The big boys dumped as much as they could on index ETFs via rebalancing and short squeezes / unloading via the upper deck selling calls and driving them just into the money. Sure, could be dangerously greedy and try to continue to squeeze blood from stones (the few shorts and put buyers left) but they cannot get much more blood. Or they can take pigs like you to the slaughterhouse and there are plenty of you nicely fattened and oblivious... Higher return play is on our side now...

Topic.Title: 27% Naked Short Position REVEALED! (IN DEPTH REPORT)

Message.Msg: Just like the guy said on CNBC - Fantastic company, Terrible stock to own. I love Amazon and shop there a lot as they have some of the best deals. And they are the most customer centric company around these days - very impressive customer service. On the flip side though - this is definitely hurting their profit margins. I wonder how Amazon would be able to grow their profits and get to a decent P/E. The stock has had a run-up of 50% this year. APPL trades at a P/E (TTM) of 9 and AMZN at a P/E of INFINITY (as their current EPS is -0.09)

Message.Title: What is a "fair" price for Amazon?
Message.Msg: Based upon optimistic earnings estimates for 2014 ($7 a share?), a 20 forward PE (twice Apple PE) might say a price of $140 for Amazon is appropriate. But future earnings are written in sand. Any rise in shipping costs, or economic slowdown, could reset the estimates. If earnings only come in at $4 in 2014, a price of $80 might be appropriate.

Message.Title: AMZN trading alert
Message.Msg: My peripheral trading system generated following trade signal before close today: “Exit Short AMZN to hold CASH at market close on 3/15/2013" Alert performance so far (since Feb 4th, 2013): -1.85%. See my previous posts for alert history.

The signal was generated before the trade time indicated in the alert statement. The signals can show up (rarely) before regular market open, (rarely) during regular trading hours, or (mostly) before regular market close.
I posted the results after extended trading was closed, for informational purposes only. It is recommended to stay Cash on earnings release dates.

Message.Title: Every day less people realize that......
Message.Msg: The stock market iz heading for a crash bigger then 2008. For the chart enthusiasts out there, if you want to know where the market iz heading all you need to do iz draw 2 linez on a long term chart: Line 1 iz from the '75 lowz to the '83 lowz and extend it out to present day..... That line , which comez to 450-475 on the s&p, takes out the bubblicious run from 1985 - 2000 where US manufacturing businesses merged, aquired, and then sold out the entire US manufacturing base that waz built up since WW II to foriegn interests so that we could buy cheap #$%$ from walmart.... Its inflation adjusted line purs us back to the equivalent economic situation of the 70's where we decoupled from the gold standard, muni's ran out of money and defaulted, and NYC went bancrupt under gerald ford. Line 2. Connect the downward sloping lowz from the bottom of 2002-2003 to the march 6, 2009 devilz bottom of 666. That downward sloping line bringz us out to 575 today. By doing so you take out the bernanke induced manufactured run generated from talf, tarp, qe 1, qe 2,operation twist, 0% fed interest rates "for an extended period of time", qe nov 2012, qe dec 2012, qe jan 2013, qe feb 2013 (collective monthly qe's known az POMO). So if you idiots want to know where the s&p is heading. its heading to valuez between 475-575 on a 'normal' crash. If we break 450 then we are in a full blown depression and possibly a world war or both at the same time. Whats going to fail to cause such a catastraphy? Muni bonds (starting with detroit), corporate bonds, swaps and derivativez contracts will be broken, every etf, commoditiez will crash, government pensionz and safety nets, global banking lock ups, housing, commercial realestate, and many many many common stox. Why will it fail? Because bernanke, the treasury and US politicianz have fired off all their bullets; too big to failerz were not fixed and now hold more risk at less moral hazard then in 2006 and have not changed - no trust.

Tech, Fidelity didnt get hurt with apple tanking, fidelity baggie buy high mutaul fund holderz in fidelity 401 k's did. Fidelity ownerz and managerz with profit share stake bonusez dont get hurt unless they drink their own koolaid (which some do). Fidelity privately held equity holderz are not required to spend their own money, they simply use everyone elsez and skim the top win, loze, or draw fidelity gets PAID. When will you learn?
SPAMMER !!
